org.wattdepot.common.util.logger

Class WattDepotLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wattdepot.common.util.logger.WattDepotLogger

  • public final class WattDepotLogger
extends Object
    Supports logging of informational and error messages by a service. Uses WattDepotUserHome.getHome() to determine where to put the logs directory. Portions of this code are adapted from http://hackystat-utilities.googlecode.com/
    Author:
    Philip Johnson, Robert Brewer

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String loggerName,
               String serverHome)
        Return the WattDepot Logger named with loggerName, creating it if it does not yet exist. WattDepot loggers have the following characteristics:
        • Log messages are one line and are prefixed with a time stamp using the OneLineFormatter class.
        • The logger creates a Console logger and a File logger.
        • The File logger is written out to the [serverHome]/logs/ directory, creating this if it is not found.
        • The File log name is {name}.%u.log.
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The name of this WattDepotLogger.
        serverHome - Home directory for this server. Logging files are placed in [serverHome]/logs. If null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Returns:
        The Logger instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If serverHome is null.
        RuntimeException - If there are problems creating directories or opening log file.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String loggerName,
               String serverHome,
               boolean hasConsole)
        Return the WattDepot Logger named with loggerName, creating it if it does not yet exist. WattDepot loggers have the following characteristics:
        • Log messages are one line and are prefixed with a time stamp using the OneLineFormatter class.
        • The logger creates a File logger.
        • The File logger is written out to the [serverHome]/logs/ directory, creating this if it is not found.
        • The File log name is {name}.%u.log.
        • There is also a ConsoleHandler (if hasConsole is true).
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The name of this WattDepotLogger.
        serverHome - Home directory for this server. Logging files are placed in [serverHome]/logs. If null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        hasConsole - If true, then a ConsoleHandler is created.
        Returns:
        The Logger instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If serverHome is null.
        RuntimeException - If there are problems creating directories or opening log file.

      • setLoggingLevel

        public static void setLoggingLevel(Logger logger,
                   String level)
        Sets the logging level to be used for this WattDepot logger. If the passed string cannot be parsed into a Level, then INFO is set by default.
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger whose level is to be set.
        level - The new Level.
